definitions.definition: An unexpected event with negative consequences occurring without the intention of the one suffering the consequences, and (in the strict sense) not directly caused by humans.
examples: to die by an accident such as an act of God

subdefinitions.definition: casus ; such unforeseen , extraordinary , extraneous interference as is out of the range of ordinary calculation .

definitions.definition: A collision or crash of a vehicle, aircraft, or other form of transportation that causes damage to the transportation involved; and sometimes injury or death to the transportation's occupants or bystanders in close proximity . ( but see Usage notes )
examples: There was a huge accident on I5 involving 15 automobiles.
My insurance went up after the second accident in three months.

definitions.definition: Any property, fact , or relation that is the result of chance or is nonessential or nonsubstantive .
examples: Lexical gaps are called accidental because their existence is by accident ; it is not essential.

subdefinitions.definition: A property attached to a word, but not essential to it, such as gender , number , or case .
Urine or feces excreted due to incontinence.
A person born from an unintended pregnancy .
examples: Taylor was our sweet little accident , and we're so glad!

definitions.definition: An irregular surface feature with no apparent cause.
A sudden discontinuity of ground such as fault of great thickness, bed or lentil of unstable ground.
A point or mark which may be retained or omitted in a coat of arms .

main_definition: An unexpected event with negative consequences occurring without the intention of the one suffering the consequences, and (in the strict sense) not directly caused by humans.
secondary_definitions: ( transport ) A collision or crash of a vehicle, aircraft, or other form of transportation that causes damage to the transportation involved; and sometimes injury or death to the transportation's occupants or bystanders in close proximity . ( but see Usage notes )
Any property, fact , or relation that is the result of chance or is nonessential or nonsubstantive .
( geology ) An irregular surface feature with no apparent cause.
( geology ) A sudden discontinuity of ground such as fault of great thickness, bed or lentil of unstable ground.
( heraldry ) A point or mark which may be retained or omitted in a coat of arms .
